messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] dentists---bah!
messages.msgSnippet: ... Don t they wish!  I figure it s genetics.  My dh has only about 3 or 4 fillings in his mouth.  Mine is full of them.  I don t think I have a tooth without
messages.messageBody:
> > Dentists aren't always right.
> > My brrod sucked thumbs n pacifiers until at least 4. In fact, middle
> > child would steal the baby's.
> > All have straight perfect teeth. Must to the dentists annoyance. he
> > couldn't even find cavitites on Monday and he tried really hard. Told
> > me it was unusual for a child to reach 10 without cavities, like I'd
> > done something wrong :-)

Don't they wish! I figure it's genetics. My dh has only about 3 or 4
fillings in his mouth. Mine is full of them. I don't think I have a tooth
without a filling. My older two inherited my (and *their* father's) bad
tooth enamel. My youngest inherited *his* dad's. He's 15 and no cavities
so far.
Tia

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] dentists---bah!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/19/2002 6:06:02 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Yeah. I sucked my thumb until about 9 years old. Beautiful teeth (although many
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/19/2002 6:06:02 PM Eastern Standard Time,
shyrley.williams@... writes:


> Dentists aren't always right.
> My brrod sucked thumbs n pacifiers until at least 4. In fact, middle
> child would steal the baby's.
> All have straight perfect teeth. Must to the dentists annoyance. he
> couldn't even find cavitites on Monday and he tried really hard. Told
> me it was unusual for a child to reach 10 without cavities, like I'd
> done something wrong :-)

Yeah. I sucked my thumb until about 9 years old. Beautiful teeth (although
many fillings)---no braces. Cameron is 15 Jan 23. No cavities so far. <G>

~Kelly
